forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny, with a high near 60. West southwest wind around 22 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. West southwest wind 9 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph.

weather_report:
As the twilight settles over Downtown San Francisco, the evening extends a gentle embrace, cloaking the city in a soft layer of cloud cover. The temperature rests comfortably around 52 degrees, a whisper of coolness carried on the west-southwest winds, which dance around the streets at a brisk pace of 9 to 22 mph. While most of the day was marked by a fleeting warmth under mostly sunny skies, the night ushers in a notable shift as the clouds gather, hinting at the familiar marine layer. The iconic silhouettes of the Golden Gate Bridge may now be shrouded in a delicate veil, making the bustling streets feel even more intimate, as if sharing a secret among themselves.

For an evening stroll or a casual dinner, light layers remain advisable. Perhaps a light jacket or sweater would serve well against the gentle wind, allowing for an easy transition from the warmth of indoor dining to the crisp outdoor air. This is no time for the stereotypical tourist traps; instead, consider a quiet café where you can sip on a warm beverage and watch the world go by, or perhaps a local bistro where the aromas of freshly cooked meals intertwine with the salty sea breeze. Tonight offers an opportunity to wander, to explore the lesser-known corners of the city, where conversations linger and laughter echoes softly in the evening air.
